Literature Review: Single-molecule tracking and imaging techniques have revolutionized the field of biology by enabling direct observation of individual biomolecules in real-time and under physiological conditions. Since the early 1990s, these techniques have been rapidly advancing, allowing researchers to follow single biomolecules in their native environments for extended periods. This review aims to discuss recent advances in single-molecule tracking and imaging techniques, with a focus on advanced three-dimensional (3D) tracking systems that achieve ultrahigh spatiotemporal resolution and sufficient working depths for tracking single molecules in 3D tissue models.
